translated: Then the brahmin Pauṣkarasāri saw the Dharma, attained the Dharma, knew the Dharma, plumbed the depths of the Dharma, overcame his doubts, became independent, overcame uncertainty, and gained full confidence, not relying on others for the teachings of the Teacher.

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽btsun pa / bdag ni; 'phags so //
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // btsun pa / bdag ni; 'phags so //
translated: He rose from his seat, drew down the right shoulder of his upper garment, bowed toward the Blessed One with palms pressed together, and made this request:🔽“Lord, I have gone for refuge.

original: mngon par 'phags so //
analyzed: mngon par 'phags so //
translated: I have truly gone for refuge.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la bdag skyabs su mchi lags kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la bdag skyabs su mchi lags kyi /
translated: I go for refuge in the Blessed One, the Dharma, and the community of monks.

original: bdag dge bsnyen du gzung du gsol /
analyzed: bdag dge bsnyen du gzung du gsol /
translated: Please accept me as a lay vow holder.

original: deng slan chad ji snyed 'tsho'i bar du srog dang yang bsdos te skyabs su mchi bar mngon par dad lags so //
analyzed: deng slan chad ji snyed 'tsho'i bar du srog dang yang bsdos te skyabs su mchi bar mngon par dad lags so //
translated: From this day forth, even at the risk of my life, I will go for refuge to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sangha.”

original: de nas bram ze padma'i snying po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' nas rjes su yi rang ste @176a *//
analyzed: de nas bram ze padma'i snying po bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' nas rjes su yi rang ste @176a *//
translated: Then the brahmin Pauṣkarasāri, rejoicing in and appreciating the words of the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas nas stan las langs te song ngo //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

analyzed: skabs su bab par bram ze padma'i snying po 'phya bar byed kyi /
translated: the brahmin Pauṣkarasāri is criticizing at the right time.

original: de lta bas na yon bsngo ba byed pa na /
analyzed: de lta bas na yon bsngo ba byed pa na /
translated: Therefore, when dedicating offerings,

original: dge slong gis bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis bza' bar mi bya'o //

original: za na / 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: za na / 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does eat, he becomes guilty of an offense.”

original: bcom ldan 'das lo ma bdun par byon nas lo ma bdun par sangs rgyas bzhi rnams kyi gdan zhes bya ba gong ma bzhin du rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lo ma bdun par byon nas lo ma bdun par sangs rgyas bzhi rnams kyi gdan zhes bya ba gong ma bzhin du rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: The Blessed One went to Saptāśīviṣa and at Saptāśīviṣa he sat on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks.

original: bcom ldan 'das ko sa la'i ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na 'char kar byon nas 'char ka na gnas tsher ma can gyi nags na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ko sa la'i ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na 'char kar byon nas 'char ka na gnas tsher ma can gyi nags na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was traveling through the country of Kosala and arrived at Icchānaṅkala. He stayed in a forest of thorny trees in Icchānaṅkala.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dge sbyong go'u ta ma ko sa la'i ljongs rgyu zhing gshegs pa na 'char kar byon nas 'char ka na gnas tsher ma can gyi nags na bzhugs so //🔽zhes thos so //

translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala heard that the ascetic Gautama was traveling through the country of Kosala and had arrived at Icchānaṅkala. He was staying in a forest of thorny trees in Icchānaṅkala.

original: thos nas kyang mi zhig la bsgo ba /
analyzed: thos nas kyang mi zhig la bsgo ba /
translated: Having heard this, he ordered a man,

original: kva'i nang rje /
analyzed: kva'i nang rje /

translated: Go to the ascetic Gautama and, with my words, bow your head to the feet of the ascetic Gautama and ask if he has little trouble,🔽little illness,

original: nyam nga ba nyung ngam /🔽'tsho'am / bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: nyam nga ba nyung ngam / 'tsho'am / bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: little discomfort,

analyzed: stobs dang bde ba la reg par spyod dam / zhes snyun gsol la /
translated: and if he is strong, healthy, and comfortable.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: And say this:

original: kye shes ldan go'u ta ma /
analyzed: kye shes ldan go'u ta ma /
translated: ‘O wise Gautama,

analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal sang bcom ldan 'das la blta bar mchi 'tshal na /

analyzed: shes ldan go'u ta mas 'di ltar snga @176b nas thugs su chud par mdzad du gsol / zhes kyang gsol cig /
translated: Please, Your Majesty, let the honorable Gautama know.”

original: lha / bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes mi des ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi ltar mnyan nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: lha / bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes mi des ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi ltar mnyan nas bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: “Your Majesty, as you wish,” the man replied, and he went to the Blessed One. When he arrived, he bowed low until his forehead touched the Blessed One’s feet, and then he sat down to one side.

analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas mi des bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he had sat down to one side, the man said to the Blessed One,

analyzed: shes ldan go'u ta ma'i zhabs gnyis la ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas gnod pa chung ngam / nyam nga ba nyung ngam /
translated: “Your Majesty, King Prasenajit bows low until his forehead touches the feet of the honorable Gautama and asks if you have little trouble,🔽little distress,

original: 'tsho'am / bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: 'tsho'am / bskyod pa yang ngam /
translated: little discomfort,🔽and are in good health and strong.

original: stobs dang bde ba la reg par spyod dam zhes snyun gsol lags so //
analyzed: stobs dang bde ba la reg par spyod dam zhes snyun gsol lags so //

analyzed: kye / skyes bu khyod dang ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal bde bar gyur cig /

original: kye / shes ldan go'u ta ma /
analyzed: kye / shes ldan go'u ta ma /

analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal sang bcom ldan 'das la blta ba'i phyir mchi bar 'tshal na /

original: shes ldan go'u ta mas 'di ltar snga nas thugs su chud par mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: shes ldan go'u ta mas 'di ltar snga nas thugs su chud par mdzad du gsol /
translated: O Gautama, please be aware of this.

original: kye nang rje /
analyzed: kye nang rje /
translated: “O man,

analyzed: nga nyid ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis dus la bab par shes par gyis shig /
translated: let King Prasenajit of Kosala know that I am aware of the time.”

original: de nas mi de bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' nas yi rang ste /
analyzed: de nas mi de bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par dga' nas yi rang ste /
translated: Then the man, delighted and pleased with the words of the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: departed from the presence of the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mi de song nas ring po ma lon par tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mi de song nas ring po ma lon par tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then, not long after the man had left, the Blessed One said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

analyzed: khyod song la gtsug lag khang yangs pa zhig tu stan mang du shoms shig / nga 'dug la deng nyid nas ko sa @177a *//

analyzed: la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal dang 'du bar bya'o //
translated: I will sit down and today itself I will meet with Prasenajit, king of Kosala.”

translated: “Honored One, as you say,” the venerable Ānanda replied, and he went to a spacious temple, prepared many seats, and then returned to the Blessed One. When he arrived, he touched his head to the Blessed One’s feet and sat to one side.

analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he had sat down to one side, the venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One,

analyzed: btsun pa / gtsug lag khang yangs pa zhig tu gdan mang du bshams lags te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol /

analyzed: de nas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal la mi des rig par byas te /

analyzed: song nas ring po ma lon par mi gzhan zhig la smras pa /

analyzed: kva'i nang rje /

analyzed: tshur shog / khyod kyis bzhon pa bzang po myur du gtod cig /

analyzed: de la kho bo zhon la de ring kho na dge sbyong go'u ta ma la blta ba'i phyir 'gro'o //

analyzed: lha / bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes mi des ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi ltar mnyan te /

original: lha / da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: lha / da de'i dus la bab par dgongs su gsol /
translated: Please consider that the time has come.

original: zhes thos so //
analyzed: zhes thos so //
translated: The two sisters Sundarī and Sutejomanditā heard, Today, the Blessed One will go to see the king.

analyzed: thos nas kyang ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal la 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: lha / gal te deng nyid bcom ldan 'das gzigs pa'i phyir gshegs na /

analyzed: lha / 'di ltar /

analyzed: bdag cag gi tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la dbus phyag mdzod la / gnod pa chung ngam /
translated: please bow your head at the feet of the Blessed One on our behalf🔽and ask if he has little trouble,

analyzed: nyam nga ba nyung ngam; 'tsho'am /
translated: little illness,

original: bskyod pa yang ngam /
analyzed: bskyod pa yang ngam /

analyzed: zhes ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis mnyan nas /
